Package us.daveread.edu.graphics.test

Class Pong

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • us.daveread.edu.graphics.surface.DrawingSurface
              • us.daveread.edu.graphics.test.Pong
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, SoundPlayer
    public class Pong
extends DrawingSurface
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Classic game of Pong. Used to demonstrate the animation features of the graphics library. Sounds from http://opengameart.org/content/3-ping-pong-sounds-8-bit-style To use, create an instance and run it on a thread. 
     
 public static void main(String[] args) {
   new Thread(new Pong()).start();
 }

    Here is a link to the Source Code.

    Author:
    readda

                                          int paddleY)
        Determine the location in the paddle where the ball has hit. Return the appropriate paddle location enum value.
        Parameters:
        ballY - The Y pixel location of the ball
        paddleY - The Y pixel location of the paddle
        Returns:
        The zone of the paddle that was hit with by the ball

      • prepareForGuiUpdate

        public void prepareForGuiUpdate()
        Description copied from class: DrawingSurface
        This is a callback method that will be called just prior to the drawing surface being redrawn.

        Subclasses should override this if there are processing steps that should occur just before each GUI refresh.

        TODO Is this only called if mode is ANIMATED?

        Overrides:
        prepareForGuiUpdate in class DrawingSurface

      • handleKeyDown

        public void handleKeyDown​(int keyCode)
        Description copied from class: DrawingSurface
        This is a callback method that will be called if a keyboard key is pressed. The parameter will be the key code for the pressed key. Subclasses should override this method in order to detect a key being pressed.
        Overrides:
        handleKeyDown in class DrawingSurface
        Parameters:
        keyCode - The keycode of the pressed key
        See Also:
        KeyEvent, DrawingSurface.handleKeyUp(int)

      • handleKeyUp

        public void handleKeyUp​(int keyCode)
        Description copied from class: DrawingSurface
        This is a callback method that will be called if a keyboard key is released (after having been pressed). The parameter will be the key code for the pressed key. Subclasses should override this method in order to detect a key being pressed.
        Overrides:
        handleKeyUp in class DrawingSurface
        Parameters:
        keyCode - The keycode of the pressed key
        See Also:
        KeyEvent, DrawingSurface.handleKeyDown(int)
